acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It carried out the outside of Category from 96-hour LC50=527mg/L of fishes (Fathead minnows), and others (CERI Hazard Data, 2000).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 3 from rabbit LD50= 947mg/kg (DFGOT, 1998-ATTY, 2001).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on saturated vapor pressure pressures concentrations = 5700ppm (25degC) (Howard, 1997), rat LC50 = 8000ppm = 32.1mg/L (the collection of CERI data, 2000) was judged as the value by mist exposure and set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on Saturated vapor pressure concentration = 5700ppm (25degC) (Howard, 1997), rat LC50 = 2450ppm (ACGIH, 2003) was judged to be steam exposure value, and it was classified as Category 3.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Category 4 based on SPECIES: Rat; ENDPOINT: LD50; VALUE: VALUE:1544mg/kg;

aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May be harmful if swallowed and enters airways
aspiration_hazard.rationale: In this surver, no data of the aspiration breathing apparatus hazards, however, the dynamic viscosity is considered to be (40 degrees C) <14mm2/s (dynamic viscosity = 2.13mm 2/s (24 degrees C) (based on Renzo (3rd, 1986))), moreover, "there were also the authorities which classified the ketone of 13 or less carbon atoms," therefore we classified it as Category 2.

carcinogenicity.rationale: IARC classifies into 3 (1999) and ACGIH classifies into A3 (2003). It was set to category 2 based on the classification of ACGIH which time of assessment is the latest.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since not water-insoluble (aqueous solubility =25000 mg/L (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)) and acute toxicity is low.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Not classified because of UNRTDG No.1915, Class:  3, PG III

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Since it gave negative in the dominant lethality examination and positive in the bone marrow cells chromosomal aberration test in the rat (both of them were in CERI Hazard Data(2000)), we classified it as Category 2.

organic_peroxides.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with peroxide present in the molecule.

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon (but not to other elements).

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: In any reports, reproductive toxicity is not reported and it is indicated that there is no teratogenicity in any case. However, in high concentration of exposure, adverse effect of child under indecement of the adverse effect to maternal is reported(ACGIH(2003);DFGOTvol.10 (1998)). Therefore, it was classified into Category 2.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classified in UNRTDG No.2915, Class: 3, PGIII

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the statement of  "the human eye irritations"(PATTY (5th, 2001) and "the severe irritations in the eye of a rabbit"(CERI Hazard Data (2000), it was set as Category 2A.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was classified as Category 2 based on the description "there is moderate stimulativeness" in CERI Hazard Data (2000).

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Although a case of one human is reported (IARC (Vol71, 1999), ACGIH (2003)), since sensitization has not been identified in animals it was put outside of the Category.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (kidney, liver, central nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 (the kidney, liver, central nervous system) according to that effects to the kidney, liver, central nervous system is observed in humans (PATTY5th, 2001).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification:
Category 1 (liver, spleen, central nervous system),
Category 2 (lung),
Category 3 (narcotic effects, respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
Causes damage to organs (liver, spleen, central nervous system)
May cause damage to organs (lung)
May cause respiratory irritation (narcotic effects, respiratory tract irritation)
May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects, respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: The effects on the liver is reported by humans (DFGOT, vol.10, 1998), it was set to Category 1 (liver).  by that which . Spleen effects in rat (4250ppm = 19mg/L) (PATTY, 5th, 2001) was compared with the guidance value, and set to Category 1 (spleen). Moreover, the influence on a central nervous systems (mouse (ACGIH, 2003)) is estimated by a guidance value, and it was se to Category 1 (central nervous system). And the influence on lungs (mouse (ACGIH, 2003)) was set as Category 2 (lungs). Moreover, there is the statement that anesthesia influence in an animal (ACGIH, 2003; PATTY, 5th, 2001; DFGOT, vol10, 1998)) and human respiratory irritation (ACGIH, 2003), it is classified into Category 3 (an anesthetic actions, respiratory irritation).
